metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3268 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
An out of bounds (OOB) memory access flaw was found in the Linux kernel inrelay_file_read_start_pos in kernel/relay.c in the relayfs. This flaw couldallow a local attacker to crash the system or leak kernel internalinformation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3268` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-243-generic - 4.4.0-243.277~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-243-generic - 4.4.0-243.277~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-243-lowlatency - 4.4.0-243.277~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1121-aws - 4.4.0-1121.127
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1168-azure - 4.15.0-1168.183~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-243.277~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1121.127').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1168.183~14.04.1').
